title: Two-time heavyweight champ Foreman dies at 76
content: George Foreman, a two-time heavyweight champion, Olympic gold medalist and Hall of Fame boxer, died Friday at age 76.

title: UConn's 'amazing run' alive after record-tying win
content: Friday night's win was UConn's 13th straight in the NCAA tournament, tied with the 1991-93 Duke Blue Devils for the longest streak since the tournament expanded in 1985.

title: NYY's Schmidt set for IL, Carrasco makes roster
content: Yankees GM Brian Cashman says right-hander Clarke Schmidt will begin the season on the injured list, paving the way for non-roster invitee Carlos Carrasco to make the team.

title: Tigers clear way for prospect Jobe to join rotation
content: The Tigers have cleared the path for top prospect Jackson Jobe to open the season in the rotation by optioning right-hander Keider Montero to Triple-A.

title: Ex-cop Brown wins women's featherweight belt
content: Former police officer Tiara Brown won the women's WBC world featherweight title by beating Skye Nicolson in a split-decision victory.

title: Ingles given rare start; autistic son able to watch
content: Timberwolves coach Chris Finch gave Joe Ingles his first start since January 2022, allowing his autistic son Jacob the chance to see him play.

title: A&M's Williams addresses 'dangerous' online hate
content: Texas A&M guard Jace Carter says he has been the target of death threats and racial slurs on social media this season.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Edwards' path to victory at UFC Fight Night
content: Who has the edge in Saturday's UFC Fight Night from London? An MMA fighter and betting insider make their picks.

title: MMA madness: 16 welterweights go head-to-head
content: Is your hoops bracket already busted? Welcome to MMA madness, where predictions -- and upsets -- abound!

title: NHL playoff watch: What's at stake in all 14 games on Showdown Saturday
content: Here's what to watch in every matchup. Plus, full playoff projections, draft lottery standings and more.

title: Men's March Madness Day 2 guide: Results, analysis, keys to second round
content: Whether you missed the action or simply want to relive it, here's a rundown of all 16 games from Friday.

title: It wasn't his behavior, but this Stanford program belongs to Andrew Luck
content: Right now, all of Stanford's trust is in Luck. It's his program now, and that means Troy Taylor is his coach.

title: 'An out in three pitches': What the rest of MLB can learn from the Royals' old-school rotation
content: Five guys ... making quality starts ... day in and day out? Sounds like a bygone era. But it worked big-time for the Royals last year. Why isn't everyone else doing it?

title: Women's March Madness Day 1 guide: Analysis and recaps of all 16 games
content: From blowouts to one double-digit seed advancing, we break down all Friday's chalky opening to women's March Madness.

title: Yes, USMNT fans: It's time to worry about the 2026 World Cup
content: The U.S. national team and coach Mauricio Pochettino are running out of time to fix what's wrong before the World Cup -- and there's a lot wrong.

title: Almada golazo gives win to Messi-less Argentina
content: Argentina didn't miss Lionel Messi, Lautaro Martínez and other key players on Friday and beat Uruguay away 1-0 in convincing fashion in their South American World Cup qualifying match.

title: 'You're my idol': Henry joins Panama celebrations
content: Panama's Cecilio Waterman celebrated one of the biggest goals in his country's history, to defeat the USMNT, with his idol Thierry Henry.

title: Leon kicked out of Club World Cup by FIFA
content: Grupo Pachuca confirmed that the FIFA appeals committee on Friday ruled Club León out of participation in the 2025 Club World Cup due to the tournament's multi-ownership rules.

title: Lewis-Skelly sets England record with debut goal
content: Myles Lewis-Skelly made history on Friday by becoming the youngest player to score on his senior debut for England when he found the back of the net in the Three Lions' victory over Albania at Wembley Stadium.

title: Wood carded for signing autographs in NZ win
content: Chris Wood picked up a yellow card for signing autographs and taking pictures with fans during New Zealand's win over Fiji in their World Cup qualifier on Thursday.

title: Salah scores in Egypt World Cup qualifying win
content: Captain Mohamed Salah scored for Egypt as they eased to a 2-0 victory over Ethiopia in their 2026 World Cup qualifier on Friday, but 2022 semi-finalists Morocco needed a late winner from Bilal El Khannouss to defeat unfancied Niger.

title: Disgruntled Poch: Wearing U.S. shirt 'not enough'
content: Mauricio Pochettino was left visibly frustrated after the USMNT's shocking 1-0 defeat to Panama in the Concacaf Nations League, bluntly telling his players it was not enough to just simply show up in the national team shirt and expect to win.

title: Alisson set for Liverpool return after concussion
content: Liverpool goalkeeper Alisson Becker has withdrawn from the Brazil squad after sustaining a concussion during Thursday's World Cup qualifier with Colombia.

title: Next stop, Tampa: Experts predict women's Final Four and 2025 national champion
content: Which team will cut down the nets in Tampa? ESPN's experts pick the Final Four, the title game matchup and 2025 champion.

title: NCAA Wrestling Championships: Schedule, rules, scoring, stats
content: The NCAA men's Division I wrestling championships start Thursday; here's how to watch Penn State, Iowa and more.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United ready to move for Juve star Kenan Yildiz
content: Manchester United are strongly linked with £80m-rated Juventus forward Kenan Yildiz. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Forecaster for Week 1: March 27-30
content: Set your lineups for the week ahead in fantasy baseball with our forecaster preview, which features pitcher rankings, hitter ratings, schedule observations and more.

title: Real or not: Fundora undisputed, Boots will unify, and Ryan will solve Mayer in rematch
content: Our experts discuss notable upcoming fights, Keith Thurman's return, the next American heavyweight and more.

title: Fertilizers committee warns against under-funding of nutrient subsidy schemes
content: The report also notes the improvement in selected crop growth with modern fertilizers; urges the Centre to develop domestic production capabilities.

title: Five-day long Bihar Diwas celebrations begin at Patna’s Gandhi Maidan
content: Various government departments have set up stalls providing information about ongoing government schemes

title: India was aware of anti-Hasina wave but could not interfere, says Jaishankar
content: EAM briefs Members of Parliament on India’s foreign policy with regard to Bangladesh, Myanmar, says ‘SAARC is not off the table’

title: Justice Unplugged: Public faith in the judiciary is eroding, says former CJI Ramana
content: Justice Ramana (retd.) noted that the judiciary does not adequately reflect the country’s diversity; he emphasised that a more representative bench would enrich jurisprudence

title: Justice Unplugged: Laws should keep pace with changes in business practices, say experts
content: Experts discuss challenges in balancing privacy and data processing, emphasising the need for laws to keep pace with business changes

title: Southern states are punished for achieving targets, say Kerala CM and Karnataka Deputy CM
content: Let us channel the defiance of Periyar, the statesmanship of Annadurai, and the fire of Basavanna to reclaim the vision of India as a union of equal States, says D.K. Shivakumar

title: BRS leader Rama Rao proposes delimitation based on fiscal contribution and development
content: Mr. Rao pitches 36% representation in Parliament for the Southern States, says South should not be penalised for doing exceptionally well in political, economic and other indicators

title: Odisha Vigilance arrests govt. employees for embezzling ₹3.5 crore from State welfare funds
content: Two employees had diverted welfare funds into online betting game by forging signatures of Sarpanch and lost massive fund meant for villagers

title: After ‘Captain Abhishek’, billboards with ‘Supreme leader Mamata’ surface in Kolkata
content: Posters of ‘Odhinayak Abhishek’ and ‘Sarbadhinayika Mamata’ have come side by side in certain areas, including Jadavpur, sparking political speculation

title: Fine quality rice to enrich midday meal from next academic year: Nadendla Manohar
content: Packing of this variety of rice will be done in boxes at five logistics points in the State and sent to schools directly from there, says the Minister for Food, Civil Supplies and Consumer Affairs

title: NTA extends CUET-UG application date after aspirants report technical glitches
content: The deadline for submitting CUET-UG forms has now been extended by two days, with the revised last date being March 24

title: Symposium on colon cancer trains focus on early diagnosis
content: At ‘Colon Cancer Symposium 2025’, experts discussed various aspects of the disease, its prevention, management and treatment

title: Kannada activists temporarily disrupt Coffee Santhe
content: According to organisers of the santhe, some activists shouted slogans, pulled down flex boards and standees, and slashed banners written in English. However, the police intervened and things returned to normal in about 20 minutes

title: Telangana and Punjab CMs chime in with opposition to delimitation
content: ‘The south Indian States could not accept the proposed delimitation as it would politically limit the States and punish them for performing well,’ Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy said

title: Kharge slams Modi government over ‘Make in India’ scheme’s unfulfilled promises
content: The BJP govt. has not delivered on the promise to make India a global manufacturing hub, says the Congress chief, citing the state of production and GDP

title: Congress seeks arrest of Punjab Police personnel who assaulted an army officer in Patiala
content: Party leaders seek a probe into the matter, after 12 police personnel allegedly beat up the Colonel and his son over a parking dispute

title: Many parts in Rayalaseema receive light rain
content: Light to moderate rain, accompanied with thunderstorm and lightning, is likely at isolated places across the State until March 25, according to IMD

title: CBI files closure report in Sushant Singh Rajput death case: Officials
content: CBI submits findings on Sushant Singh Rajput case to Mumbai court, considering further probe, closure report filed

title: Calcutta High Court orders that Dalits be allowed entry into temple in Bengal’s Nadia district
content: This is the second time in the last month that authorities in West Bengal had to intervene to help Dalits get equal rights to a place of worship; district judge, police directed to monitor situation closely

title: BJP to hold election for State president on Monday
content: It will be a token election, with a leader already selected by the Central leadership set to file the nomination, say sources

title: Yellow alert for two districts on March 23 as summer rain lashes in Kerala
content: Urumi in Kozhikode received 88.5 mm of rain until 8 p.m. on Saturday, while Udumbannoor in Idukki received 67 mm of rain until 7 p.m. on the same day

title: Sreedharan rules out K-Rail, says CM yet to write to Centre for feasible alternative project
content: Alternative proposal will obviate many of the troubles that K-Rail will give to the people, says the technocrat

title: Use of advanced communication tools in disaster management needed: official
content: Special Chief Secretary R.P. Sisodia reviews preparedness for heatwaves and monsoon season, assesses availability of manpower and equipment

title: CJI forms three-member committee for deeper probe against Justice Varma
content: Huge amounts of cash allegedly found at Justice Varma’s home during a blaze; Delhi CJ asked not to assign him any judicial work; in-house probe is “confidential procedure for institutional credibility” under CJI’s charge

title: Tripura CM chairs meeting with Reliance group for investment in the State
content: Tripura officials proposed working in sectors like IT and tech services, as well as natural gas exploration, fertiliser, ethanol production from bamboo, rubber and agro-based products, food processing, and tourism

title: Tragedy under the heel of a cybercrime crackdown
content: At Alwar’s Teliyabas hamlet in Rajasthan, an early morning raid by police ended with the death of a month-old infant of Meo labourers. Aroon Deep reports on the protests thereafter, and the area that accounts for a larger part of India’s smartphone-based fraud

title: Remedial teaching, retest for students who do not score minimum marks
content: List of students who do not get 30% marks in the written exam in each subject will be prepared and they will be provided with remedial teaching from April 8 to 24

title: International workshop begins at NSU in Tirupati
content: 200 online and 60 offline participants are taking part in the one-week workshop on ‘Sabdhabodhamimamsa’

title: Kerala to ‘look east’ to increase prospects in foreign tourism
content: Titled ‘Look East’, Kerala Tourism will hold a special marketing campaign in eight eastern countries, including  China and Australia, to attract more tourists to the State

title: Justice Unplugged: Reading case laws and exposure to litigation important in legal education, say experts
content: Legal experts at Justice Unplugged emphasize the importance of critical thinking over AI in legal education.

title: Governor calls for campaign against drug abuse
content: Strict action against drug abuse, awareness activities, and surveillance using advanced technology, including artificial intelligence and rehabilitation will be part of it

title: Volunteers play guardians as Olive Ridleys return to the Thiruvananthapuram shoreline to lay eggs
content: Wildlife Trust of India volunteers are bent on protecting around 230 eggs of the turtles, which returned to the district’s coast last year after a gap of around 10 years. The group has moved the eggs, which face numerous threats, to a safe place and enlisted local people for their safekeeping

title: Natural farming only cure for rising health problems, say speakers at Millets Mela
content: We should not only grow what is suitable for the local soil, but also eat what is locally grown to beat malnutrition, says retired IAS officer B. Janardhan Reddy

title: Plan to propel Wagamon in Idukki as top paragliding centre, says Kerala Minister
content: Tourism and Public Works Minister P.A. Mohamed Riyas inaugurates the concluding ceremony of the International Paragliding Festival

title: Honey-trap case: Congress top brass embarrassed, disappointed by way it was handled
content: Central leaders said to be upset that issue was not resolved in party-level meetings, but raised in the House providing fodder to the Opposition BJP

title: Constitution will ensure return of peace in Manipur: SC judge
content: One day, complete peace will return to Manipur and the state will prosper like the entire country,” Justice Gavai added, urging the people of the state to work together to restore peace and normalcy

title: Participatory disaster management project launched in Wayanad
content: The core objectives of the project include establishing local weather monitoring systems, empowering communities to anticipate potential disasters, and developing effective mitigation mechanisms in coordination with local governing bodies

title: Man kills self on live stream in M.P.; wife, mother-in-law held for ‘harassment’
content: Rewa police cite evidence to say that wife also watched the live stream where he explained his ordeal before taking his life

title: Survey confirms encroachment behind auditorium at Kallai
content: The surveyor says at least 25 cents on the southern side of the auditorium fall under revenue land and adds that the findings have been sent to higher authorities for further action

title: United Democratic Front plans series of protests in April
content: Coastal march will be organised from April 21 to April 29 in protest against Centre’s offshore sand mining proposal and the State government’s lukewarm opposition to it

title: Poor response to Karnataka Bandh in Kittur, Kalyana Karnataka regions
content: The Bandh called by pro-Kannada organisations against the alleged attack on a state-run transport bus conductor in Belagavi evoked a poor response in the Kalyana Karnataka and Kittur Karnataka regions on Saturday with the bandh being limited to symbolic protest marches and demonstrations.

title: Krunal Pandya's triple strike turns the tide as RCB crush KKR in IPL opener
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) launched their IPL 2025 campaign with a seven-wicket victory against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) at Eden Gardens. RCB, led by Rajat Patidar, chased down 175 runs with standout performances from Phil Salt (56) and Virat Kohli (59 not out). Krunal Pandya's three-wicket haul crippled KKR, who managed 174/8 in their 20 overs.

title: US govt sends 'warning' letter to 10 highest-paid consulting cos: Explain ...
content: The Trump administration is scrutinizing federal consultancies like Booz Allen and Accenture, demanding clear reports on their government contracts and cost-cutting plans. Accenture's stock fell due to reduced US government work. The investigation aims to curb waste and spending in the $759 billion federal contract market, affecting major firms such as IBM and General Dynamics.

title: IPL: Kohli reaches new milestone with heroics in KKR vs RCB opener
content: Virat Kohli reached a milestone of over 1,000 runs against Kolkata Knight Riders by scoring 59 not out, leading Royal Challengers Bengaluru to victory. Kohli's solid partnership with Phil Salt, and a strong bowling performance from RCB, enabled them to chase down the target of 175 in just 16.2 overs.

title: At least 3 killed, 14 injured in mass shooting at New Mexico park
content: At least three people were killed and 14 others injured in a mass shooting at Young Park in Las Cruces, New Mexico. Police are investigating the incident, with assistance from state and federal agencies, and are asking for public help to identify the suspect or suspects.

title: 'Close all Zerodha accounts ...': Customer message that got CEO into action
content: Sachin Jha was compelled to close his Zerodha account due to a compliance issue when his wife joined a global investment bank. Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath responded promptly, addressing the trust gap with an action plan, although Jha ultimately closed his account.

title: We know only as much: Badar Khan Suri's sister claims family kept in the dark
content: Badaer Khan Suri's father who lives in India told TOI that he and his son visited Gaza only once to ask for Mapheze's hand in the marriage. Mapheze Saleh is Suri's wife, an American citizen of Palestinian descent and her father Ahmed Yousef is a former adviser to Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh. Yousef left politics almost a decade ago.

title: Dashed to the hills: How 'killer' Meerut wife, her lover tried to evade police
content: Muskan Rastogi and Sahil Shukla, accused of murdering Muskan’s husband Saurabh Rajput, fled to Himachal Pradesh after the crime. They presented themselves as a married couple and maintained a low profile. Authorities arrested them after Muskan’s father compelled her to confess. The murder involved dismembering the body and sealing it in a cement-filled drum.

title: Turkey on boil: Why mass protests have erupted against Erdogan
content: The arrest of Istanbul's opposition mayor Ekrem Imamoglu sparked widespread protests across Turkey. Accused of financial misconduct and links to Kurdish militants, his detention is seen as a political move against a potential challenger to President Erdogan. Thousands have taken to the streets, demanding government resignation and supporting Imamoglu, who decries his arrest as a 'coup'.

title: More than 400 Hollywood celebrities send complaint letter against Google, OpenAI
content: Over 400 Hollywood celebrities, including Ben Stiller and Paul McCartney, have signed an open letter to the Trump administration opposing efforts to weaken copyright protections for AI training. They argue such changes would harm the creative industry, which supports millions of American jobs and significant economic contributions.

title: Lutera dulha: Man poses as 'excise officer' to dupe 3 women into marriage
content: A man has been booked for tricking three women into marriage by falsely claiming to be a widower and an excise department employee. He persuaded one to take a Rs 42 lakh loan. Police investigations reveal he has deceived other women previously and has a history of fraudulent marriages.

title: Watch: Virat Kohli dances with SRK in rare performance
content: Virat Kohli joined Shah Rukh Khan on stage at the IPL 2025 opening ceremony at Eden Gardens, celebrating Kohli's 18-season journey. The two stars danced together, thrilling the crowd with their camaraderie. KKR’s Rinku Singh later joined them, symbolically bridging the past, present, and future of cricket and entertainment. The evening concluded with the national anthem.

title: Watch: Dhoni, Hardik's tight hugs steal the spotlight
content: Hardik Pandya and MS Dhoni's heartfelt hug during a training session before the IPL 2025 clash between Mumbai Indians and Chennai Super Kings at Chepauk captured the essence of camaraderie and mutual respect. Despite fierce rivalries, this moment highlighted the deep bonds formed over years, setting an emotional tone for the highly anticipated match.

title: Amid delimitation push, Kerala CM's 'Sword of Damocles' warning
content: Tamil Nadu's DMK-led Joint Action Committee meeting, chaired by CM M.K. Stalin, united multiple state leaders against population-based Lok Sabha delimitation. They argue this move threatens democratic representation, particularly for southern states that have successfully implemented population control measures.

title: 'In single swipe': Techie slits throat of 3-yr-old son over disputes with wife
content: A 38-year-old software engineer from Chandannagar, Pune, was arrested for killing his young son due to frequent disputes with his wife. Madhava Sadhurao Tiketi, a former techie from IIT Bengaluru, admitted to committing the murder as police discovered the boy’s body and the murder weapon. Tiketi had been heavily inebriated when captured.

title: Report Of Probe Against Cash Pile Judge, His Response To Be Made Public
content: A report submitted by the Delhi High Court Chief Justice into allegations that a huge pile of cash was found at the house of a judge of the high court is being uploaded on the Supreme Court website.

title: IPL 2025: Kohli's '1000-Run' Feat Helps RCB Drub Defending Champions KKR
content: Kolkata Knight Riders vs Royal Challengers Bengaluru Highlights, IPL 2025 LIVE: RCB beat reigning champions KKR by 7 wickets, reaching their target in just 16.2 overs.

title: Mehul Choksi Surfaces In Belgium, India Begins Process To Get Him: Report
content: Fugitive businessman Mehul Choksi is living in Belgium's Antwerp with wife Preeti Choksi, a citizen of Belgium, a report by Associates Times said.

title: 'Drank 2 Bottles A Day': Driver On Meerut Murder Accused's Himachal Vacation
content: Muskaan Rastogi and her friend Sahil Shukla regularly purchased alcohol, brought a birthday cake and even visited a gurudwara during their 15-day trip to the hills from March 4, hours after they murdered a former Merchant Navy officer in Meerut.

title: 10 Bengaluru-Bound Flights Diverted To Chennai Because Of Heavy Rain
content: At least 10 flights going to Bengaluru have been diverted to Chennai due to heavy rain in the Karnataka capital, airport officials said.

title: In MK Stalin's Delimitation Push, A "Sword Of Damocles" Warning From Ally
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin hosted the first meeting of the Joint Action Committee (JAC) on delimitation in Chennai today.

title: "India Will Suffer More Financial Loss...": PCB's Warning After CT 2025
content: Ahead of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025, there was huge confusion over the venue with India refusing to travel to Pakistan

title: US Revokes Temporary Status Of 5 Lakh Migrants, To Face Deportation Soon
content: During his campaign, US President Donald Trump promised to deport millions of people who are in the US illegally.

title: Suspecting Wife Of Infidelity, Pune Techie Slits Throat Of 3-Year-Old Son
content: A 38-year-old techie in Pune suspected that his wife was in an extra-marital relationship. The price of that suspicion was paid by their three-and-a-half-year-old son who was brutally murdered by his father who slit his throat.

title: Top Court Sets Up Panel To Probe Allegations Against Judge In Cash Pile Case
content: Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna has formed a three-member committee to look into allegations against Delhi High Court judge Justice Yashwant Varma that a huge pile of cash was found at his house in the national capital.

title: IPL Opening Ceremony: Shah Rukh's Dance With Kohli, Disha's Moves Enthrall Fans
content: IPL 2025 Opening Ceremony Highlights: Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan, actress Disha Patani and star cricketer Virat Kohli shone in the opening ceremony.

title: Trump Was Asked If Sunita Williams Would Get Overtime Salary. His Response
content: Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore, who had been at the ISS since June 5 last year, were flown back to Earth early Wednesday in SpaceX's Dragon spacecraft.

title: CUET UG 2025: Registration Deadline Extended, Check  Revised Schedule
content: CUET UG 2025 Registration: The exam is tentatively scheduled to be held between May 8 and June 1 in Computer-Based Test (CBT) mode.

title: Video: Journalist, Cab Driver Argue Over 95 Paise. Internet Sides With...
content: A video of a heated exchange between a woman journalist and a cab driver allegedly over 95 paise has gone viral. While the woman accused the driver of being rude to her, the latter alleged she threatened her, saying she was a journalist.

title: Head severed, legs bent back: Autopsy reveals savagery of Meerut killing
content: Saurabh Rajput was brutally murdered by his wife, Muskan Rastogi, and her lover, Sahil Shukla, dismembering his body and sealing it in a cement drum. They manipulated family and friends, even taking a vacation post-murder. Muskan's parents called for capital punishment, and both culprits were arrested and charged with murder and destruction of evidence.

title: 'Will dispose properties of rioters to recover riot damages': CM Fadnavis
content: Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis has stated that the losses from the Central Nagpur riot will be recovered from the rioters, including through property disposal if necessary. 92 arrests have been made, with the event possibly linked to Malegaon and international instigators, and social media users spreading hatred will face stringent action.

title: 'Once MS Dhoni retires, I will stop watching cricket'
content: Ramesh Shanmugam, a para-athlete from Tamil Nadu, has excelled in wheelchair racing despite losing his legs in a childhood accident. Inspired by MS Dhoni, Shanmugam secured multiple medals at the World Para Athletics Grand Prix and Khelo India Para Games. With support from authorities, he aims to represent India in the Paralympics.

title: Muskan celebrated b'day, Holi with lover days after husband's murder
content: Muskan Rastogi and Sahil Shukla, after murdering Muskaan's husband Saurabh, were seen celebrating Holi and Muskaan's birthday. The case, involving Saurabh's disappearance and subsequent discovery of his decomposed body, unfolded that Muskaan had manipulated Sahil. Both have been charged with murder. Muskaan's parents demand strict punishment, citing her as a danger to society.

title: ‘Met his priest’: Putin 'prayed' for Trump after shooting, top US envoy reveals
content: Following an assassination attempt on Donald Trump, Russian President Vladimir Putin visited his church to pray for Trump and demonstrated goodwill through personal gestures. Steve Witkoff highlighted Trump's approach to diplomatic engagement with Russia and Putin’s positive response to negotiating the end of the Ukraine conflict, emphasizing Trump's leadership.

title: FBI issues nationwide alert over rising attacks on Tesla dealerships
content: The FBI has warned of a series of attacks on Tesla properties, including dealerships and charging stations, across the U.S. The attacks, involving arson and vandalism, are linked to political tensions surrounding Tesla and its CEO, Elon Musk. Authorities are investigating and prosecuting the offenders, while Tesla owners urge restraint against violence.

title: Supreme Court judges visit Manipur, Jairam Ramesh asks 'when will PM Modi go?'
content: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh criticised Prime Minister Narendra Modi for not visiting Manipur since violence erupted nearly two years ago, highlighting the need for a healing touch. He also questioned the delay in imposing President's rule despite constitutional collapse and criticised Home Minister Amit Shah's lack of response on the situation in Manipur.

title: Heathrow Airport 'open and fully operational' a day after fire shutdown
content: Heathrow Airport resumes full operations following a severe power outage caused by a fire at a nearby electrical substation, which led to the cancellation and diversion of 1,350 flights affecting around 200,000 passengers. The economic impact includes an estimated loss of £4.8 million per day in tourism revenue.

title: Big George and the legacy of big black men
content: George Foreman's journey from a heavyweight champion to a preacher and back to the boxing ring is highlighted. His determination to regain his title after a long hiatus and the challenges faced along the way are detailed, culminating in his eventual victory at 42 years old.

title: Musk-backed PAC offers voters $100 to sign petition against 'activist judges'
content: A PAC funded by Elon Musk is offering Wisconsin voters financial incentives to sign a petition opposing activist judges ahead of a key state Supreme Court election. The move aims to support the Republican-favored candidate, Brad Schimel, potentially impacting the judiciary's balance of power.

title: Drunk cop tries to rape colleague inside thana in Mathura, arrested
content: A sub-inspector in UP Police was arrested for allegedly attempting to rape a 27-year-old Dalit female colleague inside a police station in Mathura. The officer, who was under the influence, forcefully entered her room during the early hours and attempted assault before being detained. Departmental proceedings will lead to his termination.

title: Forced to wear nightgown all day, woman files complaint in Ahmedabad
content: A 21-year-old woman from Juhapura has filed a complaint against her husband and in-laws for harassment, compelled clothing choices, and verbal abuse post-marriage. Her husband's alcohol habit and resulting abuse were supported by his parents, leading her to seek police intervention.

title: 'Invariable support': North Korea's Kim Jong Un backs Russia in Ukraine war
content: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un affirmed his support for Russia's war in Ukraine during a meeting with Russian official Sergei Shoigu. Kim pledged unwavering support for Russia's sovereignty and security, while Shoigu conveyed Russian President Vladimir Putin's greetings and commitment to their mutual defence treaty.

title: Transgender Danes told to consult US embassy before travel
content: Denmark's travel advisory page says transgender Danes should first consult the US embassy before traveling to the US. Finland issued a similar warning for its citizens last week in light of President Trump's policies.

title: Watch: George Foreman vs Muhammad Ali in epic ‘Rumble in the Jungle’ fight
content: Boxing legend George Foreman has died at 76. Remembered for his epic bouts with Muhammad Ali and his later business success with the George Foreman Grill, Foreman also made a remarkable comeback to regain the heavyweight title at age 45, securing his place in boxing history.

title: 'North will make us secondary citizens': Telangana CM Revanth Reddy
content: Chief ministers from various states gathered in Chennai to oppose the Centre's proposed delimitation of parliamentary seats. Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin emphasized the potential legal battle, while Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan criticized the move as politically motivated. An expert panel for fair delimitation was proposed.

title: 'We pay premium fares, unacceptable': Supriya Sule slams Air India
content: NCP MP Supriya Sule criticises Air India's flight delays, urging the Civil Aviation Minister to act. Sule shared her own experience of a delayed flight, highlighting the impact on passengers. Separately, a Mohali consumer court fined Air India Rs 60,500 for delaying a refund and ordered compensation for a passenger.

title: Supreme Court judges reach Manipur to assess relief efforts
content: A Supreme Court delegation, led by Justice BR Gavai, has reached Manipur's Imphal to inspect relief camps amid ongoing ethnic violence. Their visit aims to assess and boost legal and humanitarian aid. Authorities are addressing a recent tragic incident involving the suspected rape and murder of a nine-year-old girl in a Churachandpur relief camp.

title: US ends legal status for 532,000 immigrants
content: The United States Department of Homeland Security has revoked legal safeguards for over 530,000 immigrants from these four countries who have been in the US since October 2022. The directive impacts those under the humanitarian parole program.

title: Israel's top court blocks dismissal of Shin Bet chief after removal by cabinet
content: Israel's High Court of Justice has temporarily blocked the removal of Ronen Bar, head of Israel's internal security agency Shin Bet, pending an appeal hearing. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's move to sack Bar has sparked widespread protests in Israel.

title: 'Will not be spared': Ajit Pawar threatens those intimidating Muslims
content: Maharashtra deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar has warned against attempts to intimidate the Muslim community or create communal discord, asserting they will face serious consequences. Speaking at an iftar party in Mumbai, Pawar emphasized unity and assured his support for the community, referencing the recent Nagpur violence amid protests against Mughal emperor Aurangzeb's tomb.

title: As Hungary bans pride events, critics fear Russian influence
content: Neo-Nazis march in Budapest with impunity, while Hungary's government cracks down on LGBTQ+ representation, banning Pride parades and fining a bookstore for displaying LGBTQ+ content. Prime Minister Orban faces growing criticism for corruption, nepotism, and repression, with opposition leader Peter Magyar gaining popularity.

title: Viral: Rotten, fungus-grown strawberries cleaned and repackaged- Watch video
content: A viral video shows vendors repackaging rotten strawberries as fresh, posing serious health risks. Consuming these can lead to food poisoning, liver damage, respiratory issues, and fungal infections. These practices highlight a lack of oversight by food safety authorities. People are advised to avoid moldy strawberries and ensure they're consuming fresh produce to avoid health complications.

title: 'Did no wrong': Back home, strong support for US-based scholar facing deportation
content: Badar Khan Suri, an Indian scholar in the US, faces detention amid a crackdown on alleged Hamas supporters. His family and friends in India insist on his innocence, highlighting his research-focused life and lack of political involvement. Suri's situation raises concerns about the broader scrutiny of pro-Palestinian activism in the US.

title: Finding water-ice on Moon: Chandrayaan-3 unlocks some 'hot' secrets
content: Chandrayaan-3's Chandra's Surface Thermophysical Experiment (ChaSTE) achieved unprecedented in-situ temperature measurements at the Moon's south pole, revealing higher than expected surface temperatures. These findings are crucial for understanding lunar thermophysics and potential water-ice deposits, which are essential for human habitat and exploration. The research, bridging critical knowledge gaps, was published in Nature Communications Earth & Environment.

title: Sources: Winston joining Giants for 2 years, $8M
content: free agent quarterback jameis Winston announces he has agreed to sign with the new york Giants . the deal is for two years and $8 million, sources say . it comes after weeks of the Giants flirting with Aaron Rodgers and missing out on Matthew Stafford .

title: Men's NCAA tournament live tracker: Purdue powers past McNeese, and more updates from round of 32
content: the schedule is headlined by Arkansas vs. St. John's, a matchup of two Hall of Fame coaches in Rick Pitino and John Calipari . the Houston Cougars take on the red-hot Gonzaga Bulldogs in the second round .

title: Mount St. Mary's HC Donny Lind and son reflect on tourney run
content: mount St. Mary's Mountaineers coach Donny Lind has had his son, Silas, with him for much of this season . the elder says he's enjoyed missing school, playing with his friends on the court . "it's been a blast to be able to bring him with me," he says .

title: Men's championship odds: Duke, Florida clear co-favorites
content: The 2025 NCAA men's basketball championship game will be played April 7 at the Alamodome in San Antonio.  Tops seeds  Duke ,  Florida ,  Auburn  and  Houston  are the top favorites while two-time defending champions  UConn  are 125-1 to three-peat. The initial 68-team field was announced Sunday March 16 and has now narrowed to 32 teams through the first round of the tournament. Second round: March 22 and 23 Sweet 16: March 27 and 28 Elite Eight: March 29 and 30 Final Four: April 5 Championship game: April 7 Here are odds for each school to win the men's college basketball championship, along with their odds to reach the Sweet 16, Elite Eight, Final Four and the championship game. Odds are accurate as of publication time.  For the latest odds, go to  ESPN BET .

title: Jameis Winston signing sets up Giants' next -- and more significant -- QB move
content: jameis Winston is a notable name with a well-traveled résumé . he could have played his way into a starting job with the New Orleans Saints or Cleveland Browns . the Giants aren't committed to him long term, but they can move on after this season .

title: USMNT loses to Panama again in worst performance of Pochettino era
content: Mauricio Pochettino and the united states men's national team lose 1-0 to Panama . the defeat ends the USMNT's run of three consecutive wins in the Concacaf Nations League . it's the third straight time Panama had defeated the U.S. in tournament play .

title: NCAA title test: Which women's icons got it done -- and is Paige Bueckers next?
content: Paige Bueckers is the ultimate stage for college basketball stars to cement legacies . women's players must either graduate or turn 22 before heading to the WNBA . despite the setbacks, she reached 2,000 career points in the fewest games in program history .

title: All-Star to architect: Buster Posey's plan to rebuild the Giants
content: buster Posey is six days shy of his 38th birthday and less than six months removed from a job few people of his stature have ever taken on . he has a different role: to methodically guide them there, inch by inch, meeting by meeting, transaction by transaction . "as a player, I would come in every day and have a list in my mind of what I wanted to accomplish," he says .
